nomeR 0.5.0
  • Reference

Black-box Variational Bayes for inference of footprint abundance using STAN Automatic Differentiation Variational Inference (ADVI) algorithm

infer_footprints_stan_vb.Rd

Black-box Variational Bayes for inference of footprint abundance using STAN Automatic Differentiation Variational Inference (ADVI) algorithm

infer_footprints_stan_vb(
  joint_freq_table,
  footprint_prior_diralphas = c(200, rep(1, 199)),
  ftp_background_model = c("informative_prior", "bg_fixed", "ftp_bg_fixed"),
  background_model_params = list(bg_protect_prob_fixed = 0.01, bg_protect_min = 0,
    bg_protect_max = 0.4, bg_protect_alpha = 675, bg_protect_beta = 57126),
  ftp_model_params = list(ftp_protect_min = 0.6, ftp_protect_max = 1, ftp_protect_alpha
    = 1, ftp_protect_beta = 0.01),
  ...
)

Arguments

joint_freq_table

data.frame which must contain columns S, N00,N01,N10,N11, where S represent spacings and N00,N01,N10,N11 are observed counts for 00, 01, 10 and 11 at spacing S. This table can be obtained using function nomeR::count_joint_frequencies(...)
footprint_prior_diralphas

vector containing parameters for dirichlet distribution which is used to model footprint abundances. Default vector assumes that around 50% of data is free of any footprints and all other footprint up-to 200bp have uninformative prior.
ftp_background_model

type of model used for inference.

"informative_prior"

both parameters bg_protect_prob and footprint_protect_prob as well as footprint abundances are subject for inference;

"bg_fixed"

bg_protect_prob is fixed value defined by background_model_params[["bg_protect_prob_fixed"]] and footprint_protect_prob as well as footprint abundances are subject for inference;

"ftp_bg_fixed"

bg_protect_prob and footprint_protect_prob are fixed values defined by corresponding values in background_model_params and ftp_model_params and inference runs only for footprint abundances.
background_model_params

list containing parameters for background model which must contain following elements:

`bg_protect_prob_fixed`

constant value for model parameter "bg_protect_prob" used in "bg_fixed" and "ftp_bg_fixed" models.

`bg_protect_min`

minimum allowed value for background emission probability for 1.

`bg_protect_max`

maximum allowed value for background emission probability for 1.

`bg_protect_alpha`

alpha parameter for prior beta distribution for model parameter "bg_protect_prob".

`bg_protect_beta`

beta parameter for prior beta distribution for model parameter "bg_protect_prob".
ftp_model_params

list containing parameters for footprint model which must contain following elements:

`ftp_protect_prob_fixed`

constant value for model parameter "footprint_protect_prob" used in "bg_fixed" and "ftp_bg_fixed" models.

`ftp_protect_min`

minimum allowed value for footprint emission probability for 1.

`ftp_protect_max`

maximum allowed value for footprint emission probability for 1.

`ftp_protect_alpha`

alpha parameter for prior beta distribution for model parameter "footprint_protect_prob".

`ftp_protect_beta`

beta parameter for prior beta distribution for model parameter "footprint_protect_prob".
...

parameters for `rstan::vb` function. Please check `?rstan::vb`.

Value

S4 class rstan::stanfit representing the fitted results. Pleae check ?rstan::stanfit.

Examples


if (FALSE) {
 
## simple data with two ftp of 5 and 10 bps. 
## The table below is a count table of observed occurrences of
## 00, 01, 10 and 11 at spacings from 1 until 15.
 
ftp_5_10_data <- data.frame("S" = 1:15,
                            "N00" = c(1626964,1508381,
                                      1420066,1336897,
                                      1258679,1185045,
                                      1136784,1090029,
                                      1045066,1001670,
                                      959927,983020,
                                      1000410,1012326,
                                      1019633),
                            "N01" = c(0,113856,
                                      197657,276539,
                                      350664,420399,
                                      464873,507988,
                                      549466,589487,
                                      627997,601629,
                                      580965,565776,
                                      555217),
                            "N10" = c(0, 113921,
                                      197854,276862,
                                      351147,421042,
                                      465716,509005,
                                      550645,590837,
                                      629533,603328,
                                      582814,567737,
                                      557220),
                            "N11" = c(873036,758842,
                                      674423,594702,
                                      519510,448514,
                                      402627,357978,
                                      314823,273006,
                                      232543,257023,
                                      275811,289161,
                                      297930))


## variational inference for footprints in the data
vb_output <- infer_footprints_stan_vb(joint_freq_table = ftp_5_10_data,
                                      footprint_prior_diralphas = c(10,rep(1,14)))
                                      
## check output in shinyapp for 
library(shinystan)
launch_shinystan(vb_output)




}
